WRITING.TEXT: OLMOS! I fucking love that guy. He always brings the gravitas in everything he's in (Battlestar Galactica, The West Wing, etc.). I'm glad he's in this.

All four movies that he's directed since MI3 have grossed over $100 million as well (including Super 8). It will be interesting to see what J.J. Abrams directs next and if this hot streak of his continues.

I saw this on Sunday. Man, this was a really good movie. Brutal, sometimes insightful, with wonderful performances from all involved. Dafne Keen is going to be a huge star. I got really teary eyed at the end there. Bravo, James Mangold and company.
Oren Peli did this. He directed Paranormal Activity, which grossed $107.9 million domestically.
When you see a white lady stirring tea in front of you and smiling, you get the fuck out.
Casper has one of James Horner's best musical scores, IMO. That was one of the movies I watched most as a kid, and it heavily contributed to my love of film scores today.

WRITING.TEXT:
Pretty solid number for Kong: Skull Island, IMO (better than I expected after its Thursday night gross). I don't know what kind of legs it will have, but, hey, it's looking likely to outgross the opening weekend of Peter Jackson's King Kong ($50.1 million in 2005). So that's something, I guess? The movie is enormously expensive, though, so I'm sure that Warner Bros. is hoping it will have decent legs and a good overseas gross. A $150 million final domestic gross would be respectable - the Kong/Godzilla crossover film will happen either way.
Looks like Logan got the usual superhero movie drop - but it's still likely to end up with $200 million+ in the end.
Yet another incredible drop for Get Out.
No thanks, I'll pass.
